radiographic_examinations.findings: No abnormalities other than a small calvarium.
Small brain, delayed myelination, partial agenesis of the posterior corpus callosum.
Hypodensities in frontal and parietal white matter, mild prominence of the ventricles, and extra-axial spaces containing cerebrospinal fluid. No acute hemorrhage, mass, or midline shift.
Mild bronchial-wall thickening and low lung volumes.
Increased myelination, with deficiency of the corpus callosum still present. No evidence of cerebral venous sinus thrombosis.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Normal myelination observed compared to earlier scans.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Development of thrombus in the superior sagittal sinus and engorgement of the vein of Galen.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Thrombus evolved in the vein of Galen on the next scan taken 10 days later.
